abstract: Tunisia is gathering testimony from victims of sixty years of police abuses under two dictatorships, including number of women relating tales of extreme cruelty, sexual violence and rape; so far 12,000 victims have come forward to country's Truth and Dignity Commission, most of them men; commission workers say accounts by woman are far more traumatic because of women's place of honor in conservative society.
lead_paragraph: In an Arab country where women’s rights had made advances, women are testifying about abuses under two dictatorships.

headline.main: Women in Tunisia Tell of Decades of Police Cruelty, Violence and Rape
headline.print_headline: Tortured and Violated in Tunisia, Then Shamed

snippet: In an Arab country where women’s rights had made advances, women are testifying about abuses under two dictatorships.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
